It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach heights of up to 3 meters. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in panicles, with perianth segments that are often reddish or purplish in color. Wetriaria gigantea is typically found in moist, disturbed soils and is often associated with wetland or riparian habitats.
